title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Thursday, August 10 (game #563)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Netflix's most-watched movies list this week is hot garbage, watch these 4 films instead
description: Jackie Chan's new action film is the most-watched movie on Netflix this past week, but critics say it's an absolute flop.

title: Google wants you to send AI-generated poems using its strange digital postcards
description: The tech giant has redesigned its Arts & Culture app introducing a new layout and features such as a TikTok-style Inspire feed.

title: Top VPN services can be tricked into leaking traffic outside your network
description: New flaws found in Cisco routers affecting VPN traffic routing.

title: M3 MacBooks could be coming this year, after chip shortage turnaround
description: New rumors report that Apple could be releasing the M3 MacBook in either 2023 or 2024, thanks to snagging a year's supply of 3nm shipments.

title: Your antivirus software will get a major boost from this new hacking competition
description: A new competition sponsored by DARPA will pit information security professionals against each other to see who can better use AI tools to shore up vulnerable networks and software.

title: This major Intel security flaw could leave millions of users at risk
description: Intel processors do a lot of speculating, and hackers can exploit that.

title: Nvidia unveils upgraded chip to power the next gen of AI
description: New Grace Hopper superchip shows Nvidia has become the leader in the AI chip race, and gives no signs of slowing down.

title: Zombieverse is one of the worst-rated Netflix shows ever – but it's still proving popular
description: Netflix's new reality TV show is being trashed on Rotten Tomatoes – but its poor rating isn't putting off viewers.

title: It's official — Valve is selling refurbished Steam Decks and they're 25% cheaper
description: Valve officially unveiled refurbished Steam Decks, which not only are covered by a one-year warranty but are 25% cheaper.

title: Samsung Frame 4K TVs are the first ever digital art displays to get Dalí paintings – and I can’t stop looking
description: Samsung's Art Store has acquired the rights to a dozen Dalí paintings, bringing a surreal dimension to Samsung's The Frame TVs.

title: This new take on an ancient AMD graphics card has more memory than Nvidia’s RTX 4070
description: If you’ve been complaining about VRAM loadouts with Nvidia’s Lovelace GPUs, you don’t want to know about this RX 580.

title: Gmail will now translate your emails for you on your smartphone
description: Gmail translation feature belatedly comes to smartphones.

title: All AMD Zen CPUs hit by a major security flaw - here's what we know
description: Inception flaw can steal secrets from almost any AMD Zen chip.

title: John Wick's TV spin-off reveals intriguing new look at The Continental's young Charon
description: The Continental's Charon spies something curious in this exclusive image from the John Wick TV spin-off show.

title: Nvidia lets you run four Nvidia RTX 6000 graphics cards in new Intel-only workstation PCs in apparent dig at AMD (and its ThreadRipper CPUs)
description: New RTX workstations can deliver up to 192GB of GPU memory and much more

title: Slack hopes its new makeover will make your online collaboration smoother than ever
description: Slack is getting a makeover aimed at boosting collaboration for teams everywhere.

title: Nikon Zf rumors suggest the retro camera will be more powerful than expected
description: Some new Nikon Zf rumors suggest the imminent retro camera could have the camera giant's first pixel-shift mode.

title: Google is working on a Microsoft Copilot competitor for Chrome
description: Google Project IDX wants to use AI to help you create multiplatform apps from a browser.

title: VPN usage soars in Senegal amid a second wave of censorship
description: VPN sign-ups increased 2,800% above normal levels, becoming "a vital piece of infrastructure" for Senegalese citizens. Here's, what's going on right now.

title: BlueJeans closing down as it admits defeat in the video conferencing wars
description: In a busying video conferencing landscape, Verizon decides to pull BlueJeans.

title: Your Tidal account just got 6m free hi-res FLAC tracks: look for ‘HiRes’ and ‘Max’ tabs
description: Tidal's free update swaps ‘Masters’ branding for ‘Max’ and adds a significant hi-res FLAC rollout – is it the end of MQA?

title: Amazon could become a major investor in Arm ahead of IPO
description: Arm could go public soon, and Amazon looks like it might join Intel and Nvidia in sharing some cash.

title: Google Messages on your Android phone just got a major security update
description: Google has made RCS Messages the new default for Google Messages on Android and has expanded its end-to-end encryption.

title: Linkplay unveils a new enhanced music streaming box for affordable high-end audio
description: The new WiiM Pro Plus makes it even more easier to add audiophile-grade music streaming to your existing hi-fi setup.

title: Garmin's best smartwatch could get a successor soon – here's what to expect
description: Some new leaks suggest the Garmin Venu 3 series could land soon – and they could be the best Garmin watches for most people.

title: LG reveals US pricing for its wireless OLED TV and it’s less than Samsung’s Neo QLED
description: The wireless version of LG's range-topping G3 OLED TV is cheaper than we expected, or at least, the smaller models are

title: WeWork reveals "substantial doubt" about its future
description: Coworking office space provider WeWork is burning through more cash than it can afford - and the clock is ticking.

title: iPhone 15 release date narrowed to exact day by senior Apple analyst
description: Bloomberg's Mark Gurman has narrowed his prediction for the iPhone 15 release date to just one day.

title: More and more businesses are blocking ChatGPT on work devices
description: The AI chatbot that's taken the world by storm is now being met with hostility, BlackBerry report finds.

title: Is Raptor Lake Refresh going to be a winner for Intel? New leak shows a beefy mid-range CPU
description: This is a promising glimpse of the Core i5-14600KF, which may not be too far off launching now.

title: The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra might finally upgrade a neglected camera
description: The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra's 3x telephoto camera might have five times as many megapixels to play with.

title: Take-Two seemingly hints again at GTA 6 being released before March 2025
description: Take-Two is hinting at a release date for GTA 6 in its predictions for the upcoming fiscal year.

title: Red Dead Redemption selling for $50 is "commercially accurate" according to Take-Two
description: Take-Two believes that selling Red Dead Redemption 1 on PS4 and Switch for $50 is a "commercially accurate" price point.

title: Baldur's Gate 3 expansion would be "very hard" to make thanks to D&D's quirks, warns dev
description: Larian founder Swen Vinke hasn't ruled out an expansion but confirms that we'd have "to wait for a long time."

title: Xbox Game Pass's awesome $1 trial just got less awesome
description: Microsoft's once-superb $1 Xbox Game Pass Ultimate trial has been cut in half.

title: Amazon confirms a second Prime Day is coming in October 2023
description: Amazon’s bringing the Prime Big Deal Days sale to 19 countries in October.
